methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.format
params.description: Format type. The default is "jpeg". Supported formats: - 'jpeg'

params.name: data.file_prefix
params.description: Required. File name prefix for the generated sprite sheets. Each sprite sheet has an incremental 10-digit zero-padded suffix starting from 0 before the extension, such as "sprite_sheet0000000123.jpeg".

params.name: data.sprite_width_pixels
params.description: Required. The width of sprite in pixels. Must be an even integer.

params.name: data.sprite_height_pixels
params.description: Required. The height of sprite in pixels. Must be an even integer.

params.name: data.column_count
params.description: The maximum number of sprites per row in a sprite sheet. The default is 0, which indicates no maximum limit.

params.name: data.row_count
params.description: The maximum number of rows per sprite sheet. When the sprite sheet is full, a new sprite sheet is created. The default is 0, which indicates no maximum limit.

params.name: data.start_time_offset
params.description: Start time in seconds, relative to the output file timeline. Determines the first sprite to pick. The default is 0s.

params.name: data.end_time_offset
params.description: End time in seconds, relative to the output file timeline. When end_time_offset is not specified, the sprites are generated until the end of the output file.

params.name: data.total_count
params.description: Total number of sprites. Create the specified number of sprites distributed evenly across the timeline of the output media. The default is 100.

params.name: data.interval
params.description: Starting from 0s, create sprites at regular intervals. Specify the interval value in seconds.

methods.name: getFilePrefix

Each sprite sheet has an incremental 10-digit zero-padded suffix starting from 0 before the extension, such as "sprite_sheet0000000123.jpeg".
